page.title: 15Ditchling Arts and Crafts
page.content: Ditchling has a strong tradition of fine arts and crafts.The weaving school of Ethel Mairet was famous and weavers work in the village today. Emmett an artist well known for his eccentric metalographic sculptures lives locally as well as several professional artists such as Charles Knight and Margaret Milnes.The Hand_ workers Guild was formed by craftsmen collaborating to foster enthusiasm in handicrafts.They meet in the studio of the late Sir Frank Brangwyn.The Attic Club, a group of amateur painters whose original studio was in an attic, hold a local annual exhibition.The High Street has two art galleries,a craft shop with a working pottery attached and several good antique shops.These are an attraction to visitors but in recent years several have closed because of competition.
